doc.after: Like most other Proteaceae B integrifolia has proteoid roots roots with dense clusters of short lateral rootlets that form a mat in the soil just below the leaf litter These enhance solubilisation of nutrients thus allowing nutrient uptake in low nutrient soils such as the phosphorus deficient native soils of Australia Studies on B integrifolia suggest that its proteoid root mat achieves this by chemically modifying its soil environment 27
